output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have a foundational understanding of multilingual NLP and be prepared to explore more advanced topics and tools.
output.introduction: This course provides a beginner-friendly introduction to the fascinating world of Multilingual Natural Language Processing (NLP). You'll learn the basics of how computers can understand and process human language in multiple languages.

chapters.description: Introduction to NLP and its challenges when dealing with multiple languages. Overview of the importance of multilingual NLP in today's globalized world.
Understanding how computers can identify the language of a given text. Basic techniques and tools for language identification.
Explanation of character encoding schemes (e.g., UTF-8) and their importance in representing text from different languages correctly.
Exploring how tokenization (splitting text into words or sub-words) differs across languages like English, Chinese, and German.
Introduction to stemming and lemmatization techniques and their application in different languages.
Brief overview of morphological analysis and how it helps in understanding word structure in various languages.
A high-level overview of machine translation (MT) and its different approaches (rule-based, statistical, neural).
Introduction to metrics used for evaluating the quality of machine translation output (e.g., BLEU score).
Discussion of common challenges in machine translation, such as ambiguity, idioms, and low-resource languages.
Understanding how sentiment analysis can be performed on text in different languages.
Introduction to the concept of retrieving information in one language based on a query in another language.
Overview of available datasets, tools, and libraries for working with multilingual NLP (e.g., multilingual word embeddings, translation APIs).
